intro: Hibbertia fitzgeraldensis, commonly known as Fitzgerald's hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Hibbertia fitzgeraldensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
